CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 26, 1953, pg. 4, reads: "Carver Week Committee - The committee in charge of the many celebrations of Carver Week, to be held at Pittsburgh institutions, agencies, and organizations, from Jan. 4 to 10, met at Levinson Steel Company last week to map plans. Front row, left to right: Mrs. S.F. Williman, Mrs. Alma Illery, founder of the national observance; Aaron Levinson, Greater Pittsburgh chairman; Mrs. Myra Adams Johns, and Miss Mary McKibben, director of art, Pittsburgh schools.  Back row: the Rev. James B. Cayce, pastor of Ebenezer Baptist Church; Mrs. Goldie Hamilton, Mrs. Mary Marshall, Mrs. Samuel Levinson, Dr. Charles Freeble, Fr. Segwige Pregler, Mrs. Lillian A. Friedburg; C.H.W. Pulliam, director of secondary education, Pittsburgh schools, co-chairman of the Pittsburgh observance, and Mrs. Israel Oseroff. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Carver Week committee members, front row, from left: Mrs. S. F. Williman, Alma Illery, Aaron Levinson, Myra Adams Johns, Mary McKibben; back row: Rev. James B. Cayce, Goldie Hamilton, Mary Marshall, Mrs. Samuel Levinson, Dr. Charles Freeble, Fr. Segwige Pregler, Lillian A. Friedburg; C.H.W. Pulliam, and Mrs. Israel Oseroff, posed around table in interior, another pose
